image.altText: Man in blue flannelette shirt standing on street

props.synopsis: Many express frustration at a proposal to increase water bills by more than a third over four years to fund upgrades to state-owned water and sewerage infrastructure.

title.children: 'Highway robbery': Tasmanians react to proposed water bill increases

image.altText: Two middle aged men in suits

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Liberals say Labor should concede the Tasmanian election, as both parties continue discussions with crossbenchers.

title.children: Liberals call on Labor to concede Tasmanian election but Winter fights back

image.altText: Louise Elliot looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Hobart City councillor Louise Elliot wants to move Acknowledgement of Country and Welcome to Country protocols from official proceedings, arguing they are akin to religious rituals and being forced on people "against their will".

title.children: 'Fed up': Hobart councillor's push to move Acknowledgement of Country

image.altText: A female doctor carrying a stethoscope.

props.synopsis: While the wheeling and dealing continues over who will form government after the Tasmanian election, Airlie Ward and reporter Fiona Blackwood check out what the prospective governments are offering for health.

title.children: TassieCast: Can whoever forms government heal our health woes?

image.altText: Hulk Hogan, wearing a bandana and singlet, speaks with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Hogan is widely credited with transforming America's wrestling scene into a family entertainment spectacle. But his private life and political views courted controversy in his later years.

title.children: Hulk Hogan, wrestling superstar whose private life made headlines, dies at 71

image.altText: A man in a suit points at the camera

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump has celebrated Australia's decision to lift biosecurity import restrictions on US beef, saying his country will "sell so much" beef to Australia. Follow live.

title.children: Donald Trump says he wants to 'sell so much' beef to Australia

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australia's trade minister warns of return to 'law of the jungle' amid US tariffs
Gaza in the grip of a 'humanitarian catastrophe': PM Anthony Albanese
Donald Trump celebrates Australia's decision to lift biosecurity restrictions on US beef

image.altText: A woman with a child sitting in her lap sits in front of a sign reading: 18 months our 3 year is waiting for his surgery.

props.synopsis: A Bendigo mother has successfully protested and her son has received surgery after an 18-month wait for a public hospital ENT appointment amid a regional specialist shortage.

title.children: Mother stages sit-in at Royal Children's Hospital to get appointment for son

image.altText: An animated devil is in a bed next to an animated Donald Trump

props.synopsis: Just hours after Paramount bought global streaming rights for South Park in a billion-dollar deal, the 27th season opens with President Donald Trump begging Satan for sex.

title.children: South Park airs naked Trump parody as parent company Paramount merges with Skydance

image.altText: A young blonde woman smiles while sitting with a cocktail on a patio.

props.synopsis: The 23-year-old, who is in a remand centre, appeared in a Victorian court for a directions hearing ahead of his sentencing for killing his ex-partner.

title.children: Hannah McGuire's murderer, Lachlan Young, appears in court

image.altText: An illustration of a hot pink bill with blue and black liquid pouring out

props.synopsis: Australia's pharmaceuticals watchdog is investigating a spike in adverse event reports for Vyvanse, the country's most commonly prescribed ADHD medication.

title.children: Australia's most common ADHD drug has had a spike in adverse event reports

image.altText: Donald Trump and Jerome Powell in white hard hats, with Powell holding a paper

props.synopsis: The US president says it's not "necessary" to fire the Federal Reserve boss but still calls for interest rate cuts. Meanwhile, the ASX is lower in afternoon trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Trump clashes with US Fed chair but says he won't fire him

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 🎥 Awkward on-camera exchange between Powell and Trump
All eyes on inflation data ahead of rates meeting
ASX falls as miners, gold stocks weigh

image.altText: Aerial shot of a beach in Phuket, Thailand with tourists swimming in the water and sunbathing

props.synopsis: Staff at a hotel in Phuket, Thailand, found the body of an Australian man in his room, with authorities saying he was still on a call when he died.

title.children: Young Australian man found dead in Phuket hotel room

image.altText: two female students carrying handbags walk through a university campus. they are facing away from the camera

props.synopsis: Those who paid off their student loans quickly before indexation rose may regret that decision, now that HECS-HELP debts are set to be slashed by 20 per cent.

title.children: Student debt regret: What it means for those who have paid off HECS

image.altText: A man, two women and two children ride in a rickshaw at night with torches on their heads

props.synopsis: The bloodiest military battles in more than a decade between Thailand and Cambodia have reportedly killed at least 14 people — mostly civilians.

title.children: Fighting continues on Thai-Cambodian border as world leaders call for peace

image.altText: A film still showing a man wearing a blue superhero suit and white gloves and a 4 on his chest in front of a wall of flames

props.synopsis: Marvel's first family is back on the big screen with a retro aesthetic, a star-studded cast and a hunger to wipe the superhero movie slate clean.

title.children: Fantastic Four fails to make Pedro Pascal a traditional movie star

image.altText: Two men stand back while another man wields a machete.

props.synopsis: An 18-year-old man involved in an armed gang fight that sent Melbourne's Northland Shopping Centre into lockdown in May will be released from custody to complete community work.

title.children: Teen involved in Melbourne shopping centre gang fight released from custody

image.altText: Lauren Black with son Bastian and Grandma Linda

props.synopsis: Lauren says suddenly having to fill the shoes of her mum, which included moving back to her hometown to care for her dad while also raising her toddler, was a strain on her marriage.

title.children: 'Lovers to logistic managers': How caring for aging parents strains relationships

image.altText: TS dancers

props.synopsis: The International Court of Justice declared that states do have a "duty to cooperate" on addressing climate change or they risk breaching international law. It raises the question — will the Australian government heed the warning?

title.children: Climate ruling puts Australia on notice, but is Canberra listening?

image.altText: AC/DC pose for a band photo in 1976.

props.synopsis: As triple j's Hottest 100 countdown of Australian songs approaches, a small country town reflects on the Aussie music icons that played there during the "golden age" of rock 'n' roll.

title.children: Inside AC/DC's $3.20 outback Australian gig in the '70s

image.altText: Alex de Minaur stands with legs spread wide apart on court, after hitting a forehand return from the baseline.

props.synopsis: Australian number one Alex de Minaur is through to his first quarterfinal since April following a hard-earned three-set win over Jiri Lehecka at the Washington Open.

title.children: Alex de Minaur battles to reach DC Open QF, matches Alcaraz feat

image.altText: Ben O'Connor on Tour de France podium after stage 18.

props.synopsis: Having long considered the Tour de France a relentless and unforgiving challenge, Ben O'Connor roars back with a stunning stage 18 victory in the Alps to finally bury memories of the crashes he has suffered in recent years.

title.children: Aussie O'Connor tames 'cruel race' to win Tour de France stage

image.altText: Science lab

props.synopsis: The solution to Australia's productivity problem could be more investment in research and development, and a new tax on big business might be one way to achieve that.

title.children: Calls to tax big businesses that don't invest in new technology

image.altText: An artist's impression of flightless birds being attacked by a predator from above.

props.synopsis: A US biotech company that claimed to "de-extinct" dire wolves has set its sights on bringing back the moa, a large, flightless bird that once inhabited New Zealand.

title.children: Bid to 'de-extinct' large, flightless bird that once roamed New Zealand

image.altText: triple j's Abby & Tyrone wearing Hottest 100 of Australian songs merch laughing together

props.synopsis: This Saturday, we find out what Australia considers to be the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs. Here's everything you need to know.

title.children: Your guide to the Hottest 100 of Australian Songs

image.altText: Psychologist holds a teenage girl's hands while balancing a clipboard on her lap.

props.synopsis: Patients and health experts say psychological screening prior to bariatric surgery may help identify people with eating disorders, and counter potential mental health impacts of the life-changing procedure.

title.children: Push for psychological screening before weight-loss surgery

image.altText: A Tibetan man shows a framed portrait of the 11th Panchen Lama, Gedhun Choekyi Nyima.

props.synopsis: China's communist authorities forcibly disappeared the boy chosen to play a major role in the succession of the Dalai Lama, and 30 years on, Tibetan Buddhists continue to resist their attempt to take control.

title.children: Person who would pick next Dalai Lama has been missing for 30 years

image.altText: A camera on board a satellite looks down towards Earth showing part of the satellite and the planet.

props.synopsis: Starlink is said to have 200,000 users in Australia and 6 million globally.

title.children: Elon Musk's Starlink global outage caused by software failure

image.altText: A group of women smiling. They have tattooes on their arms, hands and necks.

props.synopsis: Tattoos have a long and rich history in Australia, but they have often been limited to an artistic subculture. This is the story of how they went mainstream.

title.children: 'No excuse for getting a bad tattoo': Why these artists love getting inked

image.altText: A moustachioed young man with grey hair speaks to an elderly woman.

props.synopsis: Former star of the screen and stage Henri Szeps has died after a battle with Alzheimer's disease.

title.children: 'Died as he lived': Australian actor Henri Szeps dies aged 81

image.altText: a man in an orange jumpsuit sits at a desk in a courthouse

props.synopsis: Bryan Kohberger's co-workers, cellmates and former Tinder matches have labelled him "socially awkward" and "annoying" in newly released police documents.

title.children: New documents detail 'socially awkward', 'annoying' Idaho killer

image.altText: Sussan Ley ABC

props.synopsis: The opposition leader faces a diabolical situation with the debate over whether the Coalition should abandon the 2050 net zero target.

title.children: Zero positives for Sussan Ley in the Coalition's net zero battle

image.altText: Steak, chops and pork on display in butcher's window

props.synopsis: The federal government has lifted longstanding restrictions on beef imports from the US. This is what it means for Australia.

title.children: Cattle producer says Australia must be open to eating US beef

image.altText: Ali France and Albanese

props.synopsis: From the return of federal parliament to a fresh debate on the "spirit of cricket", it's been a big week in news. Test your knowledge.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: Federal parliament returns, the 'spirit of cricket' and a top dog

image.altText: A woman standing outside a police station, wearing a stern expression.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government is considering changing the law in an effort to drive down the costs of coronial inquests. But a lawyer from the Kumanjayi Walker probe says police used far more resources than the community.

title.children: NT government flags capping coronial spends after $8m Walker inquest

image.altText: Max Verstappen in the pit lane, looking on, while wearing a cap

props.synopsis: The three-week break between the British Grand Prix at the start of July to this weekend's race in Belgium has been one of the more chaotic periods in Formula 1's recent history.

title.children: Verstappen rumours intensify, Red Bull's new era and Piastri resumes title fight
